title: 16. The Succession
description: How Augustus attempted to manage succession and the problems created by Rome’s non-hereditary political system.

questions.question: Why was succession a particular problem for Augustus?
options: He refused to plan for it
The principate was hereditary by law

questions.question: What personal factor encouraged Augustus to plan carefully for succession?
Why could Augustus not simply pass on the principate like a monarchy?
options: Roman law forbade inheritance of power

questions.question: What lesson may Augustus have drawn from the death of Julius Caesar?
options: That the Senate could not be trusted

questions.question: How did Augustus generally promote potential successors?
options: By granting them military commands only
By associating them with offices and powers

questions.question: Which powers were commonly granted to possible heirs?
Who was Augustus’ first intended successor?
What signalled Marcellus’ promotion as heir?
options: Permission to hold office ten years early

questions.question: Why did Marcellus cease to be a candidate for succession?
Why was Agrippa considered a potential successor?
options: He was popular with the plebs

questions.question: Which evidence suggests Agrippa was almost Augustus’ equal?
options: His portrayal as colleague on coins
His election as consul for life

questions.question: Which heirs were designated princeps iuventutis?
What honours were given to Gaius and Lucius Caesar at a young age?
Why did Augustus’ plans for Gaius and Lucius fail?
How does Velleius Paterculus portray the accession of Tiberius?
What accusation does Tacitus make regarding Tiberius’ succession?
options: That he seized power by force

questions.question: Why was Tiberius required to adopt Germanicus?
What cynical explanation does Tacitus give for Augustus choosing Tiberius?
options: Tiberius’ flaws made Augustus look better
